venue.name: The Jackie Liebergott Black Box Theatre, Paramount Center

item.description:
Made in America: Our Gun Violence Culture

February 04, 2013 6:30pm
Jackie Liebergott Black Box Theatre
Paramount Center
Free and open to the public

In the first of a series of panels examining America’s unique culture of gun violence, we will focus on gun control and gun advocacy in the U.S.

The panel will be moderated by WGBH news anchor Emily Rooney and will include the President of Meredith Management and founder of Stop Handgun Violence John Rosenthal; Northeastern University’s College of Criminal Justice Associate Dean for Graduate Studies and Research and Director of the Institute on Race and Justice Jack McDevitt; Director of the Gun Owners’ Action League (Massachusetts NRA) and counter-terrorism specialist Steve Moysey; and President of the Independent Firearm Association and author Richard Feldman.

This event is free but seating is limited and will be on a first-come, first-seated basis. Doors open at 6 pm.

http://www.emerson.edu/news-events/featured-events/made-america-our-gun-violence-culture
item.name: GOAL at Emerson College Gun Control Debate
